In contemporary [[ll|Chinese]] language and [[Chinese culture|culture]], several terms are used for the concept of love:
 
In contemporary [[ll|Chinese]] language and [[Chinese culture|culture]], several terms are used for the concept of love:
 
 
−
*''Ai'' (愛) is both a verb (e.g. ''Wo Ai Ni'' 我愛你, or "I love you") and a noun (such as ''Ai Qing'' 愛情, or "romantic love"). This is the most often used word for love, and can have a variety of meanings in different contexts, just as it is in English. Since 1949, mainland China has been using the word ''[[wikt:airen|Ai Ren]]'' (愛人, originally "lover") as the dominant term for "spouse" (while separate terms for "wife" and "husband" retained, they were de-emphasized to promote gender equality); the word once had a negative connotation in China, which is still true among many in [[Taiwan]].
+
*''Ai'' (愛) is both a verb (e.g. ''Wo Ai Ni'' 我愛你, or "I love you") and a noun (such as ''Ai Qing'' 愛情, or "romantic love"). This is the most often used word for love, and can have a variety of meanings in different contexts, just as it is in English. Since 1949, mainland China has been using the word ''[[wikt:airen|Ai Ren]]'' (愛人, originally "lover") as the dominant term for "spouse" (while separate terms for "wife" and "husband" retained, they were de-emphasized to promote gender equality); ''Ai Ren''once had a negative connotation in China, which is still true among many in [[Taiwan]].
 
 
 
*''Lian'' (戀) describes the state of personal attachement and dependence as a result of love, and as such is rarely used alone. It is often used specifically to describe romantic or sexual love, such as "being in love" (戀愛, ''Lian Ai''), "lover" (戀人, ''Lian Ren'') or "[[homosexuality]]" (同性戀, ''Tong Xing Lian'').
 
*''Lian'' (戀) describes the state of personal attachement and dependence as a result of love, and as such is rarely used alone. It is often used specifically to describe romantic or sexual love, such as "being in love" (戀愛, ''Lian Ai''), "lover" (戀人, ''Lian Ren'') or "[[homosexuality]]" (同性戀, ''Tong Xing Lian'').
